narrative.title: Scene 3-1
paragraphs: Daddy spends the afternoon assembling the new bed; the old crib is taken apart, and they pack the crib away in the attic. The girl tests the change during the day and naps in the new bed several times.

That night, Mommy and Daddy share a worried glance as she climbs under the covers. They tuck her in, smooth the blanket, and tiptoe into the hall, leaving the door slightly open while the house slowly becomes quiet.

Theadora sits up to check the child, attentive and careful, still wondering about the missing crib. Lumpy looks carefully at the open edge of the bed where bars used to be; his movements are small and anxious.
Flops drops onto the bed with a light giggle, enjoying how bouncy it feels, and Theadora signals her to stop to avoid waking the girl.

Stitch arrives at last, looking old but experienced. He reminds the stuffies what they sign up for: keeping the girl safe in her sleep. His chest rises bravely. Theadora reads his words as clear advice and steadies the team. They must make sure the girl is safe as the night truly begins.

examples: She shot him a worried glance.
One glance told him it was late.

Mommy and Daddy exchange a worried glance as the girl climbs into the new bed.
Her parents tuck her in and tiptoe away, leaving the door slightly open as the house grows still.
Theadora sits up, checks the child, and wonders where the crib went.
Lumpy notices the missing bars and looks anxious.
Flops lands with a giggle and declares the bed is bouncy; Theadora scolds.
Stitch arrives—the old-timer the others trust.

distractors: They store the crib in the garage after they pack it away.
The parents leave and shut the door completely after saying goodnight.
Flops says the mattress feels hard, and Theadora praises her.
